text: I cloned a git repo with 100+ Pluto notebooks, and Pluto does not have a file browser (that I have been able to find). Any advice?

elements.text: I cloned a git repo with 100+ Pluto notebooks, and Pluto does not have a file browser (that I have been able to find). Any advice?

text: <@U01CQTKB86N> Put your cursor in the box to open a file and type `./`. You should get a selectable list of files. If you type more characters it will restrict the list

text: On the Pluto home page that opens when you first do `Pluto.run()`

Pluto.run()

text: Ah yes, I see now. Easy enough. Thanks <@U67G3QRJM>.

elements.text: Ah yes, I see now. Easy enough. Thanks

text:
For linux user, one can put this line in your `.bashrc` .
```alias pluto='julia -e "using Pluto
if length(ARGS) > 0
    notebook = ARGS[1]
    Pluto.run(notebook=joinpath(pwd(), notebook))
else
    Pluto.run()
end"'```
Then type `pluto filename.jl` to open it.

elements.text: For linux user, one can put this line in your
.bashrc

alias pluto='julia -e "using Pluto
if length(ARGS) > 0
    notebook = ARGS[1]
    Pluto.run(notebook=joinpath(pwd(), notebook))
else
    Pluto.run()
end"'
Then type
pluto filename.jl
to open it.

text: <@UCD4Z3NJZ> Oh excellent trick there. Every little convenience helps :slightly_smiling_face:.

elements.text: Oh excellent trick there. Every little convenience helps

text:
This works better for me due to project, and this is a mac.
```alias pluto='julia --project=@. -e "using Pluto
if length(ARGS) > 0
    notebook = ARGS[1]
    Pluto.run(notebook=joinpath(pwd(), notebook))
else
    Pluto.run()
end"'```

elements.text: This works better for me due to project, and this is a mac.

alias pluto='julia --project=@. -e "using Pluto
if length(ARGS) > 0
    notebook = ARGS[1]
    Pluto.run(notebook=joinpath(pwd(), notebook))
else
    Pluto.run()
end"'
